Bren school home > Undergraduate > Student resources
Undergraduate Student Resources

ICS Student Organizations

ICS students are encouraged to participate in student organizations to complement their academics.  Below is a list of student organizations within the Donald Bren School of ICS. 

ICS Student Council

The ICS Student Councl is the official student government for the Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences. Their aim is to improve the lives of students academically, professionally and socially.

iCAMP

Interdisciplinary Computation and Applied Mathematics Program

iCAMP provides an opportunity for undergrads to learn about a topic in computational applied mathematics. Opportunities are also available for paid summer research.

WICS

Women in Computer Sciences

By joining WICS, female students can surround themselves with their peers and positive influences who, not only work with and can assist them with their classes and curriculum, but can also help them network with other successful women, giving them even more opportunities to succeed.

ACM

Association for Computing Machinery, Student Chapter

The Association for Computing Machinery is the world's largest society of information technology students and professionals. The chapter represents the needs of the UCI computing community.

INSA

Informatics Student Association

INSA works to unite the Informatics community at UCI and to promote the Informatics major to students and companies alike. We offer workshops, corporate visits and tours, individual tutoring and mentoring, tournaments and competitions and networking/recruiting events with technology companies.

UCF

Undergraduate Computing Federation

Promotes interaction between and provide resources to students with an interest in Unix, Linux, FreeBSD, Network Security, Cryptography, or Ethical Hacking. Open to all UCI undergraduate or graduate students.

IGDA

International Game Developers Association, OC Chapter

MAISS

Management Information Student Society

MAISS is tailored to the interests of BIM majors at UC Irvine as well as those interested in Business & Technology. On such a heavily-populated campus, it's often difficult to find peers in the same major who go through the same joys and struggles as you do. With Business Information Management (BIM) majors few and far between, the need for a tight-knit community is even greater. At MAISS, we bring together BIM majors to share the journey of personal growth and professional development. You'll be able to connect with other BIM majors and create lifelong friendships in the process. MAISS recognizes the challenges that BIM students face and strives to expose BIM students to various resources that will equip them for the real world post-graduation.
